member.name: IMFTransform.AddInputStreams
member.summary: Adds one or more new input streams to this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Number of streams to add.
Array of stream identifiers. The new stream identifiers must not match any existing input streams.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The MFT has a fixed number of input streams.

member.name: IMFTransform.DeleteInputStream
member.summary: Removes an input stream from this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Identifier of the input stream to remove.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The transform has a fixed number of input streams.
The stream is not removable, or the transform currently has the minimum number of input streams it can support.
The transform has unprocessed input buffers for the specified stream.

member.name: IMFTransform.GetAttributes
member.summary: Gets the global attribute store for this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Receives a pointer to the interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The MFT does not support attributes.

member.name: IMFTransform.GetInputAvailableType
member.summary: Gets an available media type for an input stream on this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Input stream identifier. To get the list of stream identifiers, call .
Index of the media type to retrieve. Media types are indexed from zero and returned in approximate order of preference.
Receives a pointer to the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The MFT does not have a list of available input types.
The dwTypeIndex parameter is out of range.
You must set the output types before setting the input types.

member.name: IMFTransform.GetInputCurrentType
member.summary: Gets the current media type for an input stream on this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Input stream identifier. To get the list of stream identifiers, call .
Receives a pointer to the interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The input media type has not been set.

member.name: IMFTransform.GetInputStatus
member.summary: Queries whether an input stream on this Media Foundation transform (MFT) can accept more data.
member.param: Input stream identifier. To get the list of stream identifiers, call .
Receives a member of the enumeration, or zero. If the value is MFT_INPUT_STATUS_ACCEPT_DATA, the stream specified in dwInputStreamID can accept more input data.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The media type is not set on one or more streams.

member.name: IMFTransform.GetInputStreamAttributes
member.summary: Gets the attribute store for an input stream on this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Input stream identifier. To get the list of stream identifiers, call .
Receives a pointer to the interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The MFT does not support input stream attributes.

member.name: IMFTransform.GetInputStreamInfo
member.summary: Gets the buffer requirements and other information for an input stream on this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Input stream identifier. To get the list of stream identifiers, call .
Pointer to an structure. The method fills the structure with information about the input stream.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFTransform.GetOutputAvailableType
member.summary: Gets an available media type for an output stream on this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Output stream identifier. To get the list of stream identifiers, call .
Index of the media type to retrieve. Media types are indexed from zero and returned in approximate order of preference.
Receives a pointer to the interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The MFT does not have a list of available output types.
The dwTypeIndex parameter is out of range.
You must set the input types before setting the output types.

member.name: IMFTransform.GetOutputCurrentType
member.summary: Gets the current media type for an output stream on this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Output stream identifier. To get the list of stream identifiers, call .
Receives a pointer to the interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The output media type has not been set.

member.name: IMFTransform.GetOutputStatus
member.summary: Queries whether the Media Foundation transform (MFT) is ready to produce output data.
member.param: Receives a member of the enumeration, or zero. If the value is MFT_OUTPUT_STATUS_SAMPLE_READY, the MFT can produce an output sample.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The media type is not set on one or more streams.

member.name: IMFTransform.GetOutputStreamAttributes
member.summary: Gets the attribute store for an output stream on this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Output stream identifier. To get the list of stream identifiers, call .
Receives a pointer to the interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The MFT does not support output stream attributes.

member.name: IMFTransform.GetOutputStreamInfo
member.summary: Gets the buffer requirements and other information for an output stream on this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Output stream identifier. To get the list of stream identifiers, call .
Pointer to an structure. The method fills the structure with information about the output stream.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFTransform.GetStreamCount
member.summary: Gets the current number of input and output streams on this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Receives the number of input streams.
Receives the number of output streams.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFTransform.GetStreamIDs
member.summary: Gets the stream identifiers for the input and output streams on this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Number of elements in the pdwInputIDs array.

param.name: pdwInputIDs
param.para: Pointer to an array allocated by the caller. The method fills the array with the input stream identifiers. The array size must be at least equal to the number of input streams. To get the number of input streams, call .
If the caller passes an array that is larger than the number of input streams, the MFT must not write values into the extra array entries.

member.param: Number of elements in the pdwOutputIDs array.

param.name: pdwOutputIDs
param.para: Pointer to an array allocated by the caller. The method fills the array with the output stream identifiers. The array size must be at least equal to the number of output streams. To get the number of output streams, call .
If the caller passes an array that is larger than the number of output streams, the MFT must not write values into the extra array entries.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: One or both of the arrays is too small.

member.name: IMFTransform.GetStreamLimits
member.summary: Gets the minimum and maximum number of input and output streams for this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Receives the minimum number of input streams.
Receives the maximum number of input streams. If there is no maximum, receives the value MFT_STREAMS_UNLIMITED.
Receives the minimum number of output streams.
Receives the maximum number of output streams. If there is no maximum, receives the value MFT_STREAMS_UNLIMITED.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFTransform.ProcessEvent
member.summary: Sends an event to an input stream on this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Input stream identifier. To get the list of stream identifiers, call .
Pointer to the interface of an event object.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The media type is not set on one or more streams.
The pipeline should not propagate the event.

member.name: IMFTransform.ProcessInput
member.summary: Delivers data to an input stream on this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Input stream identifier. To get the list of stream identifiers, call .
Pointer to the interface of the input sample. The sample must contain at least one media buffer that contains valid input data.
Reserved. Must be zero.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description:
The input sample requires a valid sample duration. To set the duration, call .
Some MFTs require that input samples have valid durations. Some MFTs do not require sample durations.

The input sample requires a time stamp. To set the time stamp, call .
Some MFTs require that input samples have valid time stamps. Some MFTs do not require time stamps.
The transform cannot process more input at this time.
The media type is not set on one or more streams.
The media type is not supported for DirectX Video Acceleration (DXVA). A DXVA-enabled decoder might return this error code.

returns.div: Note If you are converting a DirectX Media Object (DMO) to an MFT, be aware that S_FALSE is not a valid return code for IMFTransform.ProcessInput, unlike the IMediaObject.ProcessInput method.

member.name: IMFTransform.ProcessMessage
member.summary: Sends a message to the Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: The message to send, specified as a member of the enumeration.
Message parameter. The meaning of this parameter depends on the message type.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: Invalid stream number. Applies to the MFT_MESSAGE_NOTIFY_END_OF_STREAM message.
The media type is not set on one or more streams.

member.name: IMFTransform.ProcessOutput
member.summary: Generates output from the current input data.
member.param: Bitwise OR of zero or more flags from the enumeration.
Number of elements in the pOutputSamples array. The value must be at least 1.
Pointer to an array of structures, allocated by the caller. The MFT uses this array to return output data to the caller.
Receives a bitwise OR of zero or more flags from the enumeration.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The method was called on an asynchronous MFT that was not expecting this method call.
Invalid stream identifier in the dwStreamID member of one or more structures.
The transform cannot produce output data until it receives more input data.
The format has changed on an output stream, or there is a new preferred format, or there is a new output stream.
You must set the media type on one or more streams of the MFT.

returns.div: Note If you are converting a DirectX Media Object (DMO) to an MFT, be aware that S_FALSE is not a valid return code for IMFTransform.ProcessOutput, unlike the IMediaObject.ProcessOutput method.

member.name: IMFTransform.SetInputType
member.summary: Sets, tests, or clears the media type for an input stream on this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Input stream identifier. To get the list of stream identifiers, call .
Pointer to the interface, or NULL.
Zero or more flags from the enumeration.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The MFT cannot use the proposed media type.
The proposed type is not valid. This error code indicates that the media type itself is not configured correctly; for example, it might contain mutually contradictory attributes.
The MFT cannot switch types while processing data. Try draining or flushing the MFT.
You must set the output types before setting the input types.
The MFT could not find a suitable DirectX Video Acceleration (DXVA) configuration.

member.name: IMFTransform.SetOutputBounds
member.summary: Sets the range of time stamps the client needs for output.
member.param: Specifies the earliest time stamp. The Media Foundation transform (MFT) will accept input until it can produce an output sample that begins at this time; or until it can produce a sample that ends at this time or later. If there is no lower bound, use the value MFT_OUTPUT_BOUND_LOWER_UNBOUNDED.
Specifies the latest time stamp. The MFT will not produce an output sample with time stamps later than this time. If there is no upper bound, use the value MFT_OUTPUT_BOUND_UPPER_UNBOUNDED.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The media type is not set on one or more streams.

member.name: IMFTransform.SetOutputType
member.summary: Sets, tests, or clears the media type for an output stream on this Media Foundation transform (MFT).
member.param: Output stream identifier. To get the list of stream identifiers, call .
Pointer to the interface, or NULL.
Zero or more flags from the enumeration.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The transform cannot use the proposed media type.
The proposed type is not valid. This error code indicates that the media type itself is not configured correctly; for example, it might contain mutually contradictory flags.
The MFT cannot switch types while processing data. Try draining or flushing the MFT.
You must set the input types before setting the output types.
The MFT could not find a suitable DirectX Video Acceleration (DXVA) configuration.

member.name: IMFTransform
member.summary: Implemented by all Media Foundation Transforms (MFTs).
